qas.question: How many times more abundant than silver is uranium in the Earth's crust?
How many kilograms of uranium may be contained in the oceans?
Why is the concentrate of uranium in farmland so high?
What is the concentration of uranium in sea water?
How many times less abundant than silver is uranium in the Earth's crust?
How many pounds of uranium may be contained in the oceans?
Why is the concentrate of uranium in farmland so low?
What is the concentration of uranium in fresh water?
What is the concentration of plutonium in sea water?

context: Uranium's average concentration in the Earth's crust is (depending on the reference) 2 to 4 parts per million, or about <a0_0><b4_0>40<b4_0/><a0_0/> times as abundant as silver. The Earth's crust from the surface to 25 km (15 mi) down is calculated to contain 1017 kg (2×1017 lb) of uranium while the oceans may contain <a1_0><b5_0>1013<b5_0/><a1_0/> kg (2×1013 lb). The concentration of uranium in soil ranges from 0.7 to 11 parts per million (up to 15 parts per million in farmland soil due to use of <a2_0><b6_0>phosphate fertilizers<b6_0/><a2_0/>), and its concentration in sea water is <a3_0><b7_0><b8_0>3 parts per billion<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/>.
